newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA corn export sales highlights in latest reporting week:

Net sales of 491,800 MT were off one-quarter from the previous week and one-fifth from the 4-week average. The major buyers were Japan (252,900 MT, reflecting 261,100 MT in new sales, 46,400 MT destination changes, and 54,600 MT in cancellations), Mexico (106,600 MT), Saudi Arabia (90,000 MT, reflecting 35,000 MT in new sales and 55,000 MT destination changes), and Costa Rica (72,400 MT). Decreases of 161,100 MT were reported for unknown destinations.

Sales activity of 47,900 MT for the 1997/98 marketing year were mainly for Japan (46,700 MT). Exports of 658,300 MT were 23 percent below the prior week and 30 percent under the 4-week average. The primary destinations were Japan (309,500 MT), Egypt (78,500 MT), Saudi Arabia (60,000 MT), and South Korea (55,100 MT).
